question_text: Unicameral legislatures are popular in
subject: government
related_lessons: Advantages and Disadvantages of Unicameral Legislature
explanation: A central feature of any constitution is the organization of the legislature. It may be a unicameral body with one chamber or a bicameral body with two chambers. Unicameral legislatures are typical in small countries with unitary systems of government (e.g., Denmark, Sweden, Finland, Israel, and New Zealand) or in very small countries (e.g., Andorra, Dominica, Luxembourg, Liechtenstein, Malta, and Tuvalu).

question_text: In the cabinet system of government, individual responsibility of ministers means that ____________
subject: government
explanation: Individual ministerial responsibility is a constitutional convention that makes government ministers responsible for not only their own actions, but also for those of their department. It is not to be confused with collective cabinet responsibility, which states that cabinet members must approve publicly of its collective decisions or resign.

options.answer: only ministers can be held responsible for errors
a minister must hold his subordinates responsible for his failures
the prime ministers can remove an erring minister
no individual can be held responsible for government decisions

question_text: An important aspect of an unwritten constitution is that it
subject: government
explanation: An unwritten constitution is a constitution not embodied in a single document but based chiefly on custom and precedent as expressed in statutes and judicial decisions. It means that a state or country does not have a single written law functioning as a constitution. In such states, the customs and values, which are expressed in statutes provide the organic and fundamental law of such state.

options.answer: is easy to understand to everybody

question_text: In 1993, Nigerian troops were on peace-keeping assignment to
subject: government
explanation: In 1993, Nigerian troops were on peace-keeping assignment to Liberia and Somalia.

question_text: Power refers to the__________
subject: government
explanation: Power is the capacity of an individual to influence the conduct (behaviour) of others. The term "authority" is often used for power that is perceived as legitimate by the social structure.

options.answer: ability to impose one’s will upon others
duties an individual imposes on himself
duties political parties demand of their registered members

question_text: The creation of more states in Nigeria has_______
subject: government
explanation: Nigeria runs a federal system of government which has a central government at the top which is the federal government, an intermediary government in charge of states which includes the state governors, and finally the grassroots government, which includes the Local Government. The creation of states in Nigeria started out with only 12 states but more number of states have been added by past Heads of State until it got to its present number now which is 36. One benefit of the creation of states is that it reduces marginilization: There are many ethnic groups in Nigeria unlike it is in other countries of the world and the creation of more states will give them more access to power and reduce the cry that they are marginilized. Larger states tend to create dissatisfaction among ethnic minorities and the feeling of ethnic seclusion from power.

options.answer: reduced the gap between the rich and poor states
increased the powers of the federal government
increased the powers of the states and local government

question_text: An Agency of the United Nations which specializes in the welfare of children is the _______
subject: government
explanation: The United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund was created by the United Nations General Assembly on 11 December 1946, to provide emergency food and healthcare to children in countries that had been devastated by World War II.

question_text: The second ballot is based on the principle that a successful candidate must obtain
subject: government
explanation: The second ballot is an electoral system in which the voters choose between the two candidates with the greatest number of votes in an earlier election that fails to produce a majority for any one candidate.

question_text: The tenure of the president of the UN Security Council is
subject: government
explanation: The President of the United Nations Security Council is the presiding officer of that body. The President is the head of the delegation from the United Nations Security Council member state that holds the rotating presidency. The term length is one month. Article 30 of the United Nations Charter states that the Security Council is empowered to establish rules of procedure, "including the method of selecting its President". The Security Council has established the following method of selecting the president: the presidency rotates monthly among the state members of the Security Council. The rotation takes place in alphabetical order of the member states' official United Nations names in English. All members of the Council, including the President, must present credentials issued by either the head of state, the head of government, or the minister of foreign affairs of their respective states to the Secretary-General, except if the representative is also the head of government or minister of foreign affairs.

question_text: Political authority is vested in the_________
subject: government
explanation: Political authority can be defined as the power to control and direct the behaviour of people who live within a person or groups of persons’ area of influence. Political authority grants members of a government the right to rule over citizens using coercion if necessary (i.e., political legitimacy), while imposing an obligation for the citizens to obey government orders (i.e., political obligation).
